Package main.java.progOO2.p01

package main.java.progOO2.p01

Programming Object Oriented II: YourFirstAccount

This package introduces the fundamental concepts of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) through a simple class: Account.

Key concepts applied:

  • Encapsulation: the fields balance and owner are declared private to protect the internal state of the object.
  • Methods: operations such as deposit(), withdrawal() and saldo() allow controlled interaction with the object's data.
  • Constructor: the constructor initializes an account with a specific owner and starting balance.
  • toString() override: the method is overridden to provide a custom textual representation of the object.
  • Abstraction: the class models a simplified bank account, hiding implementation details from the user.

Important: This code is protected and must not be modified, as it serves as a foundation for structured OOP learning.
